result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonas Ray Bustillos Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage) [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 7/6/22.

miscConds.notes: Restitution set at $1,240.00 payable to M.J.G.

Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
Defendant to pay all nonwaivable costs, asessments and surcharges including the DNA and DV surcharges and restitution during the period of probation.  Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

Court advised defendant of appellant  rights.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with M.J.G. which rises to the level of probable cause.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
DV assessment imposed as to both counts.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonas Ray Bustillos Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonas Ray Bustillos in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea and sentencing hearing held.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 5 days served. Huber privileges for work.

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 5 days served. Huber privileges for work.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS .

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with M.J.G. which rises to the level of probable cause.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- DV assessment imposed, as to both counts.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges and restitution during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

- Restitution set at $1,240.00 payable to M.J.G.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 7/6/22.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Jonas Ray Bustillos in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  
Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Rosenthal requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-05-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Jonas Ray Bustillos in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. The victim requests the no contact order be modified. State objects. Court DENIES the request. Defendant may be eligible for Mental Health Court and defense requests a status conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonas Ray Bustillos in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. M.G. requests the no contact order be modified. Court takes the request under advisement. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Morgan J G.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jonas Ray Bustillos in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Jonas Ray Bustillos in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonas Ray Bustillos appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION ONCE REVIEW IS COMPLETE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
